text:
References
 1. 
 Global update on the health sector response to HIV, 2014. Geneva: World Health Organization; 
 2014:168. 
 2. 
 WHO, UNICEF, UNAIDS. Global update on HIV treatment 2013: results, impact and 
 opportunities. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013:126. 
 3. 
 Consolidated guidelines on the use of antiretroviral drugs for treating and preventing HIV infection: 
 recommendations for a public health approach. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013:272. 
 4. 
 Global report: UNAIDS report on the global AIDS epidemic 2013. Geneva: UNAIDS; 2013. 
 5. 
 WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean, UNAIDS. Accelerating HIV treatment in 
 the WHO Eastern Mediterranean and UNAIDS Milddle East and North Africa regions. Cairo: 
 WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean; 2013:1–32. 
 6. 
 UNAIDS. 2013 Regional report for the Middle East and North Africa. Cairo: UNAIDS; 2013:84. 
 7. 
 HIV surveillance in the WHO Eastern Mediterranean Region: regional update 2012. Cairo: WHO 
 Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean; 2012. 
 8. 
 Mumtaz GR, Weiss HA, Thomas SL, Riome S, Setayesh H, Riedner G, et al. HIV among people 
 who inject drugs in the Middle East and North Africa: systematic review and data synthesis. PLoS 
 Med. 2014;11(6):e1001663. 
 9. 
 UNGASS narrative reports 2010, 2012 and 2014: by country (online database) (http://www.
 unaids.org/en/dataanalysis/knowyourresponse/countryprogressreports/2014countries/, accessed 5 
 September 2014).
 10.  Service delivery approaches to HIV testing and counselling (HTC): a strategicHTC programme 
 framework. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2012. 
 11.  HIV and adolescents: guidance for HIV testing, and counselling and care for adolescents living 
 with HIV. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013:100. 
 12.  WHO, UNAIDS, UNICEF. Global HIV/AIDS response: epidemic update and health sector 
 progress towards universal access: progress report 2011. Geneva: World Health Organization; 
 2011:233. 
 13.  The situation of HIV testing and counselling policies and practices in the Eastern Mediterranean 
 Region. Cairo: WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean; 2011:17. 
 14.  WHO, UNAIDS. Statement on HIV testing and counseling: WHO, UNAIDS re-affirm opposition 
 to mandatory HIV testing (http://www.who.int/hiv/events/2012/world_aids_day/hiv_testing_
 counselling/en/index.html, accesses 24 January 2014).
 15.  Abu-raddad LJ, Akala FA, Semini I, Riedner G, Wilson D, Tawil O. Characterizing the HIV/AIDS 
 epidemic in the Middle East and North Africa: time for strategic action. Washington DC: World 
 Bank; 2010. 99
 16.  Mumtaz GR, Kouyoumjian SP, Hilmi N, Zidouh A, El Rhilani H, Alami K, et al. The distribution 
 of new HIV infections by mode of exposure in Morocco. Sex Transm Infect. 2013 Nov;89(3):49–56. 
 17.  Alipour A, Haghdoost AA, Sajadi L, Zolala F. HIV prevalence and related risk behaviours among

 and prevention in serodiscordant couples: recommendations for a public health approach. Geneva:

 19.  IATT Laboratory & Child Survival Working Group. Early infant diagnosis. Geneva: IATT; 
 2012:1–9. 
 20.  Mukolo A, Villegas R, Aliyu M, Wallston KA. Predictors of late presentation for HIV diagnosis: a 
 literature review and suggested way forward. AIDS Behav. 2013;17(1):5–30. 
 21.  Krentz HB, Gill MJ. The direct medical costs of late presentation (<350/mm3) of HIV infection 
 over a 15-year period. AIDS Res Treat. 2012;757135. 
 22.  Antinori A, Coenen T, Costagiola D, Dedes N, Ellefson M, Gatell J, et al. Late presentation of HIV

 23.  Jani IV, Sitoe NE, Alfai ER, Chongo PL, Quevedo JQ, Rocha BM, et al. Effect of point-of-care

 24.  Rosen S, Fox MP. Retention in HIV care between testing and treatment in sub-Saharan Africa: a

 25.  Kranzer K, Govindasamy D, Ford N, Johnston V, Lawn SD. Quantifying and addressing losses

 26.  WHO, UNAIDS, UNICEF. Global AIDS response progress reporting 2014: construction of 
 core indicators for monitoring the 2011 United Nations Political Declaration on HIV and AIDS. 
 Geneva: UNAIDS; 2014. 
 27.  WHO, UNICEF, UNFPA, UNAIDS. Towards the elimination of mother-to-child transmission of 
 HIV: conceptual framework for the Middle East and North Africa Region. Cairo: WHO Regional 
 Office for the Eastern Mediterranean; 2012. 
 28.  The strategic use of antiretrovirals to help end the HIV epidemic. Geneva: World Health 
 Organization; 2012. 
 29.  Global tuberculosis report 2013. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2013. 
 30.  Surveillance of HIV drug resistance in adults receiving ART (acquired HIV drug resistance). 
 Geneva: World Health Organization; 2014. 
 31.  Surveillance of HIV drug resistance in adults initiating antiretroviral therapy (pretreatment HIV 
 drug resistance). Geneva: World Health Organization;2014. 100
 From HIV testing to lifelong care and treatment
 32.  Antiretroviral (ARV) ceiling price list, May 2013. Clinton Health Access Initiative(http://www.
 clintonhealthaccess.org/news-and-information/ARV-Ceiling-Price-List-May-2013, accessed 15 
 January 2015).
 33.  Antiretroviral treatment in the spotlight: a public health analysis in Latin America and the Carribean 
 2013. Washington DC: Pan American Health Organization; 2013. 
 34.  Access to antiretroviral drugs in low-and middle-income countries: technical report July 2014. 
 Geneva: World Health Organization; 2014. 
 35.  Transaction prices for antiretroviral medicines from 2009 to 2012. WHO AIDS medicines and 
 diagnostics services global price reporting mechanism. Summary report November 2012. Geneva: 
 World Health Organization; 2012. 
 36.  Increasing access to HIV treatment in middle-income countries: key data on prices , regulatory 
 status, tariffs and the intellectual property situation. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2014. 
 37.  Regional strategy for health sector response to HIV, 2011–2015. Cairo: WHO Regional Office for 
 the Eastern Mediterranean; 2015. 
 38.  WHO Regional Committee for the Eastern Mediterranean resolution EM/RC60/R.1 Annual 
 report of the Regional Director.  Cairo: WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean; 2013 
 (http://applications.emro.who.int/docs/RC60_Resolutions_2013_R1_15134_EN.pdf?ua=1)
 39.  HIV test-treat-retain cascade analysis: guide and tools Cairo: WHO Regional Office for the Eastern 
 Mediterranean; 2014. The initiative to “End the HIV treatment crisis” in the WHO Eastern Mediterranean Region was launched in 
 2013 with the vision of scaling-up access to treatment to achieve universal coverage by 2020. This progress report 
 provides the status of access to the continuum of HIV care in the Region, using data available up to end 2013. The 
 report also describes actions that countries can take scale up access to HIV treatment.
